patch 8.2.0567: Vim9: cannot put comments halfway expressions

Solution:   Support # comments in many places.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/55b0fb7001ae42a58c10ad93a9157113f77a43d2|patch 8.2.0568: the man filetype plugin overwrites the unnamed register>
patch 8.2.0568: the man filetype plugin overwrites the unnamed register

Problem:    The man filetype plugin overwrites the unnamed register.
Solution:   Use the black hole register. (Jason Franklin)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0568: the man filetype plugin overwrites the unnamed register · vim/vim@55b0fb7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0568: the man filetype plugin overwrites the unnamed register · vim/vim@55b0fb7
attachments.text: Problem: The man filetype plugin overwrites the unnamed register. Solution: Use the black hole register. (Jason Franklin)

patch 8.2.0569: build failure with tiny version

Problem:    Build failure with tiny version.
Solution:   Add #ifdef.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c5f1ef53c24cc0c9f7b2131609e916f913634feb|patch 8.2.0556: Vim9: memory leak when finding common type>
patch 8.2.0556: Vim9: memory leak when finding common type

Problem:    Vim9: memory leak when finding common type.
Solution:   Store allocated memory in type growarray.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0556: Vim9: memory leak when finding common type · vim/vim@c5f1ef5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0556: Vim9: memory leak when finding common type · vim/vim@c5f1ef5
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: memory leak when finding common type. Solution: Store allocated memory in type growarray.

patch 8.2.0559: clearing a struct is verbose

Problem:    Clearing a struct is verbose.
Solution:   Define and use CLEAR_FIELD() and CLEAR_POINTER().

attachments.title: patch 8.2.0559: clearing a struct is verbose · vim/vim@a80faa8

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e6085c53506e38d07334faa1002ee90b1933b128|patch 8.2.0561: Vim9: cannot split function call in multiple lines>
patch 8.2.0561: Vim9: cannot split function call in multiple lines

Problem:    Vim9: cannot split function call in multiple lines.
Solution:   Find more arguments in following lines.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0561: Vim9: cannot split function call in multiple lines · vim/vim@e6085c5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0561: Vim9: cannot split function call in multiple lines · vim/vim@e6085c5
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot split function call in multiple lines. Solution: Find more arguments in following lines.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9c7e6dd653b62f54324f3c00d69cb348d8611a9f|patch 8.2.0562: Vim9: cannot split an expression into multiple lines>
patch 8.2.0562: Vim9: cannot split an expression into multiple lines

Problem:    Vim9: cannot split an expression into multiple lines.
Solution:   Continue in next line after an operator.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0562: Vim9: cannot split an expression into multiple lines · vim/vim@9c7e6dd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0562: Vim9: cannot split an expression into multiple lines · vim/vim@9c7e6dd
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot split an expression into multiple lines. Solution: Continue in next line after an operator.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5e774c7579a4a00d3f44fdcfcb56861bd73372e4|patch 8.2.0563: Vim9: cannot split a function line>
patch 8.2.0563: Vim9: cannot split a function line

Problem:    Vim9: cannot split a function line.
Solution:   Continue in next line so long as the function isn't done.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0563: Vim9: cannot split a function line · vim/vim@5e774c7
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0563: Vim9: cannot split a function line · vim/vim@5e774c7
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot split a function line. Solution: Continue in next line so long as the function isn't done.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/23e032523e377d367e06441e88c67692a8c6c3e9|patch 8.2.0564: Vim9: calling a def function from non-vim9 may fail>
patch 8.2.0564: Vim9: calling a def function from non-vim9 may fail

Problem:    Vim9: calling a def function from non-vim9 may fail.
Solution:   Convert varargs to a list.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0564: Vim9: calling a def function from non-vim9 may fail · vim/vim@23e0325
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0564: Vim9: calling a def function from non-vim9 may fail · vim/vim@23e0325
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: calling a def function from non-vim9 may fail. Solution: Convert varargs to a list.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/675f716efb534798a3bdb651cdb272302127602a|patch 8.2.0565: Vim9: tests contain superfluous line continuation>
patch 8.2.0565: Vim9: tests contain superfluous line continuation

Problem:    Vim9: tests contain superfluous line continuation.
Solution:   Remove line continuation no longer needed.  Skip empty lines.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0565: Vim9: tests contain superfluous line continuation · vim/vim@675f716
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0565: Vim9: tests contain superfluous line continuation · vim/vim@675f716
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: tests contain superfluous line continuation. Solution: Remove line continuation no longer needed. Skip empty lines.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/1a2f4bf6c80d750615f19c34e5baddd21310c9c9|patch 8.2.0566: Vim9: variable can be used uninitialized>
patch 8.2.0566: Vim9: variable can be used uninitialized

Problem:    Vim9: variable can be used uninitialized.
Solution:   Jump to after where variable is used.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0566: Vim9: variable can be used uninitialized · vim/vim@1a2f4bf
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0566: Vim9: variable can be used uninitialized · vim/vim@1a2f4bf
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: variable can be used uninitialized. Solution: Jump to after where variable is used.
